DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Progenitor Cell Antigen CD34 Positive Selection Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Manipulation Diagnostic, Therapeutic, and Research Equipment Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the cell selection system that was used.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Progenitor Cell Antigen CD34 Positive Selection Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Manipulation Diagnostic, Therapeutic, and Research Equipment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Hematopoietic progenitor cell antigen CD34 (385 aa, 41 kD) is a cell motility process protein that is encoded by the human CD34 gene and has a role in cell-cell adhesion and may have a role in leukocyte migration._The separation of specific cells or cell populations from a heterogeneous mixture. Specifically it refers to the selective retention of a population of desired cells through recognition of cells bearing the specified characteristics._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._Move, treat, or operate with the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner._Any object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A protein found on the surface of some bone marrow and blood cells.:The separation of specific cells or cell populations from a heterogeneous mixture. Specifically it refers to the selective retention of a population of desired cells through recognition of cells bearing the specified characteristics.

Concepts.definition: Hematopoietic progenitor cell antigen CD34 (385 aa, ~41 kDa) is encoded by the human CD34 gene. This protein plays a role in cell-cell adhesion and may have a role in leukocyte migration.
The selective retention of a population of desired cells through recognition of cells bearing specific characteristics.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Hematopoietic progenitor cell antigen CD34 (385 aa, 41 kD) is a cell motility process protein that is encoded by the human CD34 gene and has a role in cell-cell adhesion and may have a role in leukocyte migration._The separation of specific cells or cell populations from a heterogeneous mixture. Specifically it refers to the selective retention of a population of desired cells through recognition of cells bearing the specified characteristics._Any object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The ISOLEX Magnetic Cell Selection System is indicated for processing autologous peripheral blood progenitor cell (PBPC) products to obtain a CD34+ cell enriched population intended for hematopoietic reconstitution after myeloablative therapy in patients with CD34-negative tumors.

The CliniMACS Cell Selection System, based on MACSTechnology, be used for clinical-scale magnetic enrichment of target cells or depletion of unwanted cells in a closed and sterile environment. The system offers a wide range of products for innovative cell therapy concepts, such as the selection of adult stem cells.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
